alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:09AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Morris County through 800 AM EDT... At 708 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Succasunna, or 9 miles west of Morristown, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Dover, Hopatcong, East Hanover, Lincoln Park, Kinnelon, Boonton, Butler, Wharton, Rockaway, Morris Plains, Mount Arlington, Mendham, Mountain Lakes, Riverdale, Netcong, Chester, Victory Gardens, Green Pond and Succasunna. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 27 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 35 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
